artists.name: Tutu
artists.comment: Great first artist.

artists.name: BFlecha
artists.comment: not sure.

artists.name: Rumore
artists.comment: Some nice sounds.

artists.name: Princess Nokia
artists.comment: Seems a bit angry.

artists.name: Bawrut
artists.comment: Funky!.

artists.name: DAWN
artists.comment: not my thing but good if it is yours.

artists.name: Prins Thomas
artists.comment: Nice bass synths, retro in a good way.

artists.name: HVOB
artists.comment: Dancey melodic electro pop bubbling gradually into techno. Like.

artists.name: Craig Richards
artists.comment: Fabric Resident. Builds, grooves, fills. Sexy! Deffo check out.

artists.name: Lanoche
artists.comment: Perfect for a Thursday afternoon.

artists.name: RayRay
artists.comment: Could be good.

artists.name: MIIIN
artists.comment: Not sure, might throw in a surprise.

artists.name: Christian Tiger School
artists.comment: yeah!.

artists.name: Daniel Brandt & Eternal Something
artists.comment: bit retro.

artists.name: Earl Sweatshirt
artists.comment: Nope.

artists.name: RP Boo
artists.comment: Not for me.

artists.name: Denis Sulta
artists.comment: Light, funky and surprising.

artists.name: Boris Chimp 504
artists.comment: out there man! Fits right in!.

artists.name: Tommy Cash
artists.comment: Move along.

artists.name: Forest Swords
artists.comment: Out there but like it.

artists.name: Arca & Jesse Kanda
artists.comment: like it.

artists.name: Dopplereffekt + Antivj
artists.comment: Scientists, artists, coders, boom!.

artists.name: Dopplereffekt + Antivj
artists.comment: Scientists, artists, coders, boom!.

artists.name: Tarik Barri ft LEa Fabrikant
artists.comment: Serious potential.

artists.name: Andy Stott
artists.comment: Could be anything, worth a look?.

artists.name: Conor Thomas
artists.comment: bass, slow, large speakers needed.

artists.name: Toxe
artists.comment: Could be just the ticket.

artists.name: BSN Posse
artists.comment: Something for everyone.

artists.name: Yung Beef
artists.comment: Someone take that autotune off him.

artists.name: Yves Tumor
artists.comment: okay if you need to slow down.

artists.name: Dj Bus Replacement Service
artists.comment: at least I think it's meant to be.

artists.name: Diego Armando
artists.comment: Gentle jazzy start to the day.

artists.name: Playback Maracas
artists.comment: Perfect for their timeslot.

artists.name: Juana Molina
artists.comment: Probably other stuff to see.

artists.name: c/o pop: Lena Willikens
artists.comment: Probably even more crazy live.

artists.name: c/o pop: Roosevelt
artists.comment: Clear retro, dancey pop voice. Bit cheesy.

artists.name: Stööki Sound
artists.comment: It has it's moments.

artists.name: Fat Freddy’s Drop
artists.comment: Might depend when you catch them. It's certainly eclectic.

artists.name: Damian Lazarus
artists.comment: Good but needs to step it up to close at Sonar Day.

artists.name: Julián Mayorga
artists.comment: Yeah, no.

artists.name: Etyen
artists.comment: Might be worth a listen if others not floating your boat.

artists.name: Sofie Winterson
artists.comment: More plinky plonky. Nice voice though.

artists.name: Lamusa
artists.comment: Plinky plonky kinda Aphex Twin but with less energy. Nice if you need to mellow out for a bit.

artists.name: River Tiber
artists.comment: nice beats and airy vocals. Easy going background.

artists.name: Suzanne Ciani
artists.comment: Difficult to say. Her albums sound pretty traditional.

artists.name: Pan Daijing
artists.comment: Serious, retro noise generation.

artists.name: Marie Davidson Pr “Bullshit Treshold“
artists.comment: some interesting sounds but goes on a bit.

artists.name: Floorplan Live (Robert & Lyric Hood)
artists.comment: Nice floor tapper.

artists.name: Kinder Malo & Pimp Flaco
artists.comment: New to me. Melodic Rapping in Spanish. Probably good if you're into this.

artists.name: Jacques
artists.comment: Certainly different but I think no.

artists.name: Evian Christ
artists.comment: This is gonna be banging unless the MCing is over the top.

artists.name: Clark
artists.comment: We need to see this.

artists.name: Aitor Etxebarria
artists.comment: Documentary of the 1937 Spanish bombing. Beautiful.

artists.name: LCC
artists.comment: Bubbling, teasing soundscapes with some banging bass beats. Fancy a peak.

artists.name: Elysia Crampton
artists.comment: Might be a bit too out there.

artists.name: Nonotak
artists.comment: Need to see this.

artists.name: Juan Ingaramo
artists.comment: Sounds like Jamiroquai, a really cheesy version.

artists.name: Kablam
artists.comment: Mental Magnet Morphing!.

artists.name: Sturla Atlas
artists.comment: Get me outta here.

artists.name: Bad Gyal
artists.comment: Poppy autotunetastic.

artists.name: DJ Florentino
artists.comment: Could be good depending on mood.

artists.name: Kiddy Smile
artists.comment: unless I took the wrong thing I'll be elsewhere.

artists.name: Mario Nieto
artists.comment: Pretty good but a little generic. Probably on too early unless you're doing Night only.

artists.name: DJ Shadow
artists.comment: Endtroducing is still a genre defining album. His latest work has some big sounds which are sure to sound epic here.

artists.name: Jon Hopkins
artists.comment: My favourite artist of the present day. Mashing classical instruments into the electronic world and a mastery of glitch that no one has matched yet.

artists.name: Moderat
artists.comment: Silky baselines, lyrics slot in. A little mainstream but excellently executed.

artists.name: Jacques Green
artists.comment: Light feeling but darker stuff too. Vocals are okay. Better use of autotune. Leaves you wanting. Pop back later if you're not feeling it.

artists.name: Soulwax
artists.comment: Intelligent retro plinky plonky but maybe should have stayed at home.

artists.name: Dubfire
artists.comment: Sway your way into Saturday morning. Some standout sounds and vocals in there too.

artists.name: Judah
artists.comment: Local talent bringing in Friday night.

artists.name: Anderson .Paak & The Free Nat
artists.comment: Not original enough for me but I'm no expert in this area.

artists.name: Clams Casino
artists.comment: Real stripped down MCing. Too much talking for me but it's got something that will attract.

artists.name: Nicolas Jaar
artists.comment: Slow build.

artists.name: Derrick Carter
artists.comment: Reasonable toe tapper.

artists.name: Nina Kraviz
artists.comment: Ambient with Dark beats. Pretty banging!.

artists.name: Ches
artists.comment: Finally MCing that doesn't grate. Some well timed beats, synths and bass drops to boot.

artists.name: Sandro Jeeawock
artists.comment: HipHop with odd harmonies. Typical Lab content.

artists.name: Little Dragon
artists.comment: Laid back. Warm sounds. Mellow vocals. Some good rhythms.

artists.name: Cashmere Cat
artists.comment: Airy fairy shit.

artists.name: AJ Tracey
artists.comment: Not my thing.

artists.name: Jlin
artists.comment: This one is out there! Gelling percussion, timbres and looped vocals and effects to create some ear pleasing noises. Original.

artists.name: Giggs
artists.comment: The MCing is decent but the repeated melodies don't provide enough interest for me. Seems a little amateur in places but might just be the upfront mic position.

artists.name: Lunice
artists.comment: Now this is interesting. MCing but layered with a variety of sounds. Plenty of crossover with various genres. Not all talking.

artists.name: Benji B
artists.comment: Ah another person who likes his voice through an autotune. Mixes it up with some slow bass but doesn't save it for me.

artists.name: Masters At Work / 6 H Set
artists.comment: If you can get in take a trip down memory lane.

artists.name: Pauk
artists.comment: Sounds very much like Wisp. Glitchy, Bassy, love it (Need to get up early for this).

artists.name: Fira Fem
artists.comment: yeah whatever.

artists.name: Telmo Trenor
artists.comment: Laid back electronic & synth to bring in Saturday.

artists.name: Joe Goddard
artists.comment: Great arps. Way better than some of the other Synthpopers.

artists.name: Zutzut & Imaabs
artists.comment: Tough one to call as material is non-existent.

artists.name: Nadia Rose
artists.comment: Good if you like that sort of thing.

artists.name: Soulection Presents Joe Kay + Jarreau Vandal
artists.comment: Shallow vocals oh and a few beats.

artists.name: Keys N Krates
artists.comment: Well put together electro dance with some fat bass and filters.

artists.name: Optimo
artists.comment: Lots of bongos but probably something for everyone.

artists.name: Ghostly Enemies
artists.comment: Good voice. Crazy Genre bending stuff. Liking it.

artists.name: Huma
artists.comment: Bit more structure and interest than Aethereal. Worth checking out.

artists.name: Crystal / Sparrows
artists.comment: Interesting boarders on cheesy but might just get away with it.

artists.name: Matmos
artists.comment: Narration, washing machines and Björk. No doubt it's weird.

artists.name: Veronica Vasicka
artists.comment: I'm in a computer game!.

artists.name: C. Tangana
artists.comment: Not my thing but shows promise.

artists.name: Suicideyear
artists.genre: Rap - Lots of angry bad words with some spacey soundscapes
artists.comment: bit annoying.

artists.name: Thundercat
artists.comment: not for me.

artists.name: Star Eyes B2 B Jubilee
artists.comment: If you wanna move check these two out.

artists.name: Anímic
artists.comment: More intelligent than some of the Electropop here. Could be good on big speakers.

artists.name: Gaika
artists.comment: Some interesting material here.

artists.name: Nosaj Thing + Daito Manabe
artists.comment: With some funky visuals, check it out.

artists.name: Sohn
artists.comment: Warm, powerful electronic with slightly vocoded vocals.

artists.name: Connectome
artists.comment: Piano, Strings, electronic and vocals by Sheldon obviously.

artists.name: Valgeir Sigurdsson
artists.comment: Doesn't really go anywhere.

artists.name: Nico Muhly
artists.comment: Something for the more discerning listener.

artists.name: Amnesia Scanner
artists.comment: Closer to music than the guy above. Do not miss!.

artists.name: Oblique & Carlos Bayona
artists.comment: The 80s will not die.

artists.name: Aethereal Arthropod
artists.comment: Even I am having trouble classifying this as music but I might check it out to be sure.

artists.name: Bejo
artists.comment: 'Mucho Chicken in the kitchen'. Need I say more.

artists.name: Deena Abdelwahed
artists.comment: This is what I'd imagined the XS room would be about. Sounds good.

artists.name: Dellafuente Y Maka
artists.comment: Couldn't find much on this group other than it's some kind of flamenco Rap.

artists.name: Total Freedom
artists.comment: Might take some time to get going but could be good.

artists.name: Fran Lenaers
artists.comment: The Enya vs Kraftwerk mashup is genius.

artists.name: Cerrone
artists.comment: Hopefully we'll be too late for this.

artists.name: Clara 3000
artists.comment: Didn't really grab me but might work on large speakers.

artists.name: Justice
artists.comment: Layered funky sounds, sure to please many.

artists.name: Heidi
artists.comment: She did a banging set for her birthday. I expect this to be as entertaining.

artists.name: Eric Prydz
artists.comment: Solid beats. I'll probably be after something a little harder but this is a good go to.

artists.name: Marco Carola
artists.comment: Drones on a bit but you won't care if you're still around.

artists.name: Fuego Squad
artists.comment: Probably too early to care but sound pretty smooth.

artists.name: Fat Freddy’s Drop
artists.comment: Will be interesting to see if they vary this appearance from the Day show.

artists.name: Nick Hook
artists.comment: A filler between FFD and De La Soul.

artists.name: De La Soul
artists.comment: Need no introduction. If this is your thing then these guys have been going for years.

artists.name: Avalon Emerson & Courtesy
artists.comment: You won't be disappointed.

artists.name: Vitalic   Odc Live
artists.comment: Might just the ticket at 4am.

artists.name: The Black Madonna
artists.comment: Saw last year at Day. Absolutely banging!.

artists.name: Ylia
artists.comment: Nice, rich sounds. Too early for some though.

artists.name: Overmono
artists.comment: Gets there eventually. Might be worth a visit.

artists.name: Carl Craig Presents Versus Synthesizer Ensemble
artists.comment: Real instruments! Anticipation. Could be quite good.

artists.name: T Q D (Royal T, Dj Q & Flava D)
artists.comment: Might be interesting what they do at Lab.

artists.name: Beautiful Swimmers
artists.comment: Apt for Lab but not as out there as some.

artists.name: Marcel Dettmann & Dr Rubinstein
artists.comment: Tamer Lab but some nice builds and steady rhythm should keep you going.

artists.name: Daphni & Hunee
artists.comment: Wasn't impressed last I saw Daphni. Recent material sounds good though and with Hunee should be much better.

artists.name: Seth Troxler & Tiga
artists.comment: You can expect a range of genres, and a queue to get in.
